alert.note: Alert for Calhoun Islands; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Refugio; Inland Calhoun; Inland Refugio; Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Aransas, Calhoun, southeastern Victoria and eastern Refugio Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 909 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Guadalupe to Tivoli to 8 miles north of Holiday Beach to near Bayside. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, Port Lavaca, Rockport, Seadrift, Port Oconnor, Guadalupe, Lamar, Point Comfort, Bayside, Long Mott, Green Lake, Holiday Beach, Tivoli, Matagorda Island State Park, Alamo Beach, Dacosta, Indianola, Bloomington, Magnolia Beach and Copano Village. This includes the following highways... US Highway 59 near mile marker 638. US Highway 87 between mile markers 816 and 840. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and south Texas.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun Islands; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Refugio; Inland Calhoun; Inland Refugio; Victoria
